trans-unit.source: Represents a specific type of access rule that is used to allow or deny an Active Directory object an extended right.
Extended rights are special operations that are not covered by the standard set of access rights.
An example of an extended right is [Send-As](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/adschema/adschema/r_send_as.asp), which gives a user the right to send e-mail for another user.

For a list of possible extended rights, see the topic [Extended Rights](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/adschema/adschema/extended_rights.asp) in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).

For more information about extended rights, see the topic [Control Access Rights](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/adschema/adschema/a_controlaccessrights.asp), also in the MSDN Library.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference and access control type.
This constructor creates an extended right access rule that applies to all extended rights.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, and Active Directory security inheritance.
Using this constructor creates an extended right access rule that applies to all extended rights.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, and extended right identifier.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
The Rights-Guid of the extended right that this access rule applies to.
For more information, see the topic Rights-Guid in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
In the Active Directory schema documentation, this information can be found in the **Rights-GUID** row on the reference page for each extended right.
If this parameter is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, the access rule applies to all extended rights.
For a list of extended rights, see the topic Extended Rights in the MSDN Library.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, Active Directory security inheritance, and inherited object type.
This constructor creates an extended right access rule that applies to all extended rights.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.
The schema GUID of the child object type that can inherit this access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, extended right identifier, and Active Directory security inheritance.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
The Rights-Guid of the extended right that this access rule applies to.
For more information, see the topic Rights-Guid in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
In the Active Directory schema documentation, this information can be found in the **Rights-GUID** row on the reference page for each extended right.
If this parameter is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, the access rule applies to all extended rights.
For a list of extended rights, see the topic Extended Rights in the MSDN Library.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ExtendedRightAccessRule"></xref> class with the specified identity reference, access control type, extended right identifier, Active Directory security inheritance, and inherited object type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"></xref> object that identifies the trustee of the access rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the access rule type.
The Rights-Guid attribute of the extended right that this access rule applies to.
For more information, see the topic Rights-Guid in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
In the Active Directory schema documentation, this information can be found in the **Rights-GUID** row on the reference page for each extended right.
If this parameter is <xref href="System.Guid.Empty"></xref>, the access rule applies to all extended rights.
For a list of extended rights, see the topic Extended Rights in the MSDN Library.
One of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"></xref> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the access rule.
The schema GUID of the child object type that can inherit this access rule.
